newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska City 585 MW coal-fired unit back Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska City 585 MW coal-fired unit back Thursday.

text.p: A 585 megawatt (MW) coal-fired plant in Nebraska City, Neb., was restored to operation Thursday after being shut earlier this month for maintenance, Omaha Public Power District said Friday.
The plant, in southeastern Nebraska near Omaha, was shut December 6 for chemical cleaning inside the boiler.
The plant came back on line as the region began recovering from a blast of Arctic air that pushed temperatures to the single digits much of the week.
Omaha Public Power District is the sole owner Nebraska City facility.
